title: [K-12] Design of an Ecological Dynamics-based Physical Education Program: Adaptive Movement Training for Social Cooperation, Cultural Relationships, and Citizenship Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic exercise science and team sports rules, foundational awareness of social cooperation and cultural diversity, and understanding of civic rights and community systems
context.additional_context: Conducted in an online-offline integrated learning environment using digital devices, emphasizing learners’ civic literacy and collaboration through team-based projects. Develops models applicable to actual school settings by referencing community-linked physical education cases. Particularly recommends program design considering historical and geographical contexts.

learning_goals: Learners design a physical education program applying ecological dynamics principles, developing agility training modules that emphasize social interaction, environmental adaptation, citizenship, and culturally responsive cooperative activities.

Learners develop ≥3 'representative learning design (RLD)' training tasks in environments simulating real-game contexts, emphasizing teamwork and cultural relevance. They reference community-linked cases to propose models applicable to actual school settings.

In groups of 3–4, learners create one adaptive movement training module for physical education. They achieve ≥80/100 points on a project rubric (creativity 20%, collaboration 30%, practicality 50%) and enhance civic collaboration and problem-solving skills. Feedback considers cultural diversity and institutional contexts.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
